meanings.definition: An instrument used to measure angles of inclination or slope.
meanings.sent1: The inclinometer showed the steepness of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker used the inclinometer to check the slope of the roof.
meanings.sent3: The inclinometer decided it was too tired to measure any more angles.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like an inclinometer, always pointing upwards.
meanings.sent5: The inclinometer's needle danced as it measured the angle of the ramp.

meanings.definition: A device that indicates the angle at which an object is tilted.
meanings.sent1: The inclinometer on the boat showed how much it was leaning.
meanings.sent2: The inclinometer in the car dashboard helped the driver stay safe on sharp turns.
meanings.sent3: The inclinometer giggled when the table tried to balance on one leg.
meanings.sent4: His mood was like an inclinometer, constantly shifting from one extreme to the other.
meanings.sent5: The inclinometer beeped loudly as the shelf started to tilt.
